Iced Guardian

As long as I know, determination gives the brute 70% chance to hit again if your blow is dodged.
I don't know exactly (or matematically) how agility influences on multiple-hits.

Remembering that determination does not incrase multi-hit rate, just increases the chance of you to hit ONE single time, and once you do, determination's effect is gone.

On september 18, 2012
coro

To clarify, FS gives you an initiative boost, and higher (relative?) speed lets you gain initiative quicker than your opponent

Certain types of weapons use a certain amount of initiative, there isn't an initiative bonus/penalty attached to any weapon (AFAIK)

Well k0l3 says to bybass a stat booster at early stages and take them later because with that way you will earn more pts.I'm saying that it is the same but now that i look at it again it's not.
Lets say you have 3 agility and take FA = 3+3=6, 6*50% +6 =9
Then at the following 2 lvls you get 3 agility lets say 5 and not 4 since you have this possibillity.So 9+5+5=19pts
Now you have 3 agility and for the next 2 lvls you get 3 agility and then FA
So hou have 3+3+3=9 , 9+3=12, 12*50% +12 =18
So since 18<19 ,always with the condition to take 5 pts instead of 4pts, its better to take it at early stages

Gordzilla
RDeviLhow to get back up in the fight?????????

When levelling up you will have the option of Back-Up or an increase in stat. When you choose Back-Up, you then need to enable it ( which costs you 1 death per day ) and it will help out your other brutes ( as long as the other brutes are of a higher level )

on the last version it was pretty much - create a brute - go to fight generator - watch ur brute 20 levels later - think if u like it - decide if u wanna keep it.
on this version ... u have to "build" ur brute around the skills u get early on.

On september 25, 2012
Gordzilla

It really all depends how much time and effort you want to put into it. I normally go into the 20's before ranking up, to see where the brutes path may lead. You can turn a poor brute into a strong brute in the matter of a few ranks. I'd say level 10 is to low, plus the more you rank up, the harder the levels get so you may find yourself upto level 20 before winning a tournement, which is 10 levels to more than you thought.

Write down the path is the #1 thing, learn the basics and read into the guides. My main brute, Gordzilla, didn't get anything fancy after level 20, so I branched at Cry of The Damned, next thing I know, I get Tragic Potion, Untouchable ( very rare ) and Fist of Fury ( which is awesome for Flail ) without branching out, I would probably never have gotten them before level 30, or at all.
On september 25, 2012
MrPapaya

U can compare but u cannot go back and choose a previous build. If u choose 'new destiny' it's like starting from 0. Like doing 'reset'


To my understanding (and correct me ppl if I'm wrong) all options given to u r still random, with the exception of some options not being offered anymore once others have been made (for example, chances to receive additional stat boosters decrease the more u get them). The game is still random, at large


The advice to measure ur brute at ~lvl10 is based out of impatience, since it gets harder and takes longer to win fights the more u lvl up (As well as rank up). If by that point ur brute is too weak, u might as well start a new one instead of fighting slowly up the XP and see if it get's better down the road. % wise - u can get kick ass at level 10 just as u may suddenly get kickass at lvl30, it would just take a looong time getting there

Gordzilla
Beroi figured i will only take the best weapons for now on but im still going for levels

If you pick ALL weapons, it will take you forever to level up, as other brutes will be much more stronger than you. A good brute is a balanced brute. Unless you have plenty of time on your hands then go for it. But what should take you a week to level up, can turn into a month. Ranking up is an opportunity for you to branch out and look to try and make your brute stronger.
You have Frying Pan, which is extremely rare, you have Sai, which is awesome on it's own, when you add things like Shield and Counter-Attack, it turns into a killer. Shuriken is good, but really only with Feline Agility. Trident is OK.

In what order where you offered those weapons, out of interest.

TheEpicFatTankSo I entered my first Brutal Legends tournament today and I was super excited thinking 128 brutes were going to be there, but it's no different than any other tournament just with everyone above level 15..... Why were people hyping BL so much. What a let down.

How many players can/must join a tournament ?
When you engage in tournaments, you have to wait for certain number of players to join the tournament.
For Padawan and Finger Flicker ranks, the total number of entrants (including your brute) is 16. In Plaster Puller and Cheeky Slapper ranks, it's 32. From Fist of Steel onwards, there will be 64 brutes per tournament.

joENI don't want to rank up and restart at level 1 ! Is this possible ?
Yes.
You can avoid ranking up, once the tournament is over, by going back to the cell and continue to play normally.
Just do not click on the link telling you to rank up when the tournament is over.
You won't be able to participate in any new tournament until you rank up with this one, though.

[5418071]

Surely you possess the intelligence to know that saying what you said is a very weak argument.

Pay to win games are a good majority of the time much more successful than neutral games. Why is this? That is because the developers reward investors in their game because that keeps them happy, and if they're happy, the developers are happy. Now why would people pay for games? To get a desired advantage over those that don't. Why do free players play Pay to win games? Because they know that even though they despise the fact the game is pay to win, they have the security of a successful revenue game that all their efforts won't be in vain a year, 2 years down the road. Everyone wins in the end.

However this same is true with games that are not pay to win or even bad games. Every game will always have its share of players who will pay for the game no matter what. This is something they decided subconsciously, they do not choose to pay for muxxu coins. Like online currency in every game it becomes a habit. Something they just do without thinking about it. It's these injustices when subconscious frequent buyers pay for games that don't reward paying players or doesn't care for their players that I hate. To me, it's thievery and as a person who care for others, I can't ignore it.

That's easy (or not) to explain.

Backup brutes attack endlessly when your main brute's FS is still active.
That includes:

1) When your opponent starts attacking and right after your backup brute shows up
2) When your opponnent starts atacking and you attack barehanded just once (FS allows you to attack twice barehanded), and then your backup brute shows up
3) When your brute starts attacking barehanded but hits only once, then your backup brute shows up.

Do you get what I mean?

On december 4, 2012
FallenRico
MrPapayaDoes Bomb count as a turn? As in, the brute throws 1 or 2 bombs instead of attacking?

Bomb works as all other throwing weapons. It takes less initiative to be used, that's why your brute usually attacks again right after it.

Weapons that take more initiative to be used:
heavy weapons > light weapons > throwing weapons (or regular weapons that are thrown)

That's why ninja brutes can throw shurikens almost incessantly, while a brute wielding an axe will need a monstruous amount of speed to attack twice in a row.

JradyHey I was just wondering if the hatchet is included in the list of weapons made better by the weapons master skill? I'm pretty sure the knife is, but I have both of those and weapons master and it seems like neither of them are made much better by it.

WM knife brutes are some of the best out there.

coro
lukasbaliukasdoes other brute will be my team mate brute or a random ant does it have infinitive lifes? i have 2

Backup is something you have to manually activate each day (at the cost of one of your 3 daily lives)

At that point, that brute can help brutes of a higher level than it (regardless of rank). I'm not sure what you mean by "i have 2", but if that's the number of brutes you have, Backup won't be very helpful to you, unfortunately

Backup brutes are similar to animals, where they can never permanently die


Edit: To be clear, backup brutes can only help your own brutes. So if you only have 2 brutes, only the one without backup can have the team fights you wanted

45424
Crystalizei can't really count in stats so i want help from someone, i just realized my brute Tyrannovirus diden't have HS but he do have 22 strength, sick ey so can someone figure out for me what his strength would be if i got HS with 22 strength, would be appreciated! Tyrannovirus

Strength value with Herculean Strength
= (22 + 3) * 150%
= 25 * 150%
= 37 (rounded down)

On february 2, 2013
45424

The base HP is 50. The bonus HP for each level up is 1.5.
It's endurance which affects the HP of a brute, and it can go to the negative. However, negative endurance values are interpreted as 0 in the calculation of health.
As you have 16 level ups, the minimum health for your brute is 50 + 16 x 1.5 + 0 x 6 = 74, and your brute's current endurance value is -1.
On february 2, 2013
FallenRico

I don't get the "+ 0 x 6"
On february 2, 2013
45424

Health = 50 + 1.5 x (level - 1) + 6 x endurance
On february 2, 2013
FallenRico

The endurance I get if I'm offered on a lvl up?
On february 2, 2013
45424

(Why isn't the endurance stat shown in the cell? )
You can treat endurance as another stat like strength and agility. Your brute has some endurance (2-4 depending on derived by your start HP) at level 1. You get extra endurance if you choose the corresponding level up choice. The calculation of endurance is exactly the same as strength, agility and speed, except that getting a pet decreases it by a fixed amount depending on the species.
The "endurance" in the formula is the current endurance stat of your brute.
